documents.title: PRD for different portion percentages in the funnel
documents.content:
ÔªøProduct Requirements Document: Different Portion Percentages

Problem Statement

Dog owners are predominantly mixed feeders, with over 80% combining various food types. This is done to achieve a balanced diet, control costs, and provide variety. The existing TPT product offering, however, primarily supports a 100% caloric intake plan. The "Topper Plan" is our only attempt to address this, but it is limited and often confusing. This represents a significant missed opportunity for TPT to align with a prevalent feeding practice and attract users who may have a lower willingness to spend on a full-calorie plan.

Goal

To introduce different portion percentages in the funnel to align with mixed feeding habits. This will be launched as an experiment to measure the impact on conversion and revenue.

* Key Actions:

   * Remove the "Topper Plan" from the plan selection flow.

   * Introduce 50% and 75% portion options alongside the 100% plan for fresh and airdried plan on plans selection (funnel), change plan (active experience) and change plan after updating pet profile

   * Expose the option to choose different percentages in the funnel only to users who indicate they are mixed feeders by adding a new question to the quiz. Active users should be able to see all options.

   * Apply these portion options to single-product plans (Fresh, Air-Dried, and eventually Pantry Fresh). The Mixed plan will remain a 100% portion plan only.

Experimentation Plan

We will run an A/B test to validate the impact of these changes. We can consider the following options:

* Option 1: Full Funnel A/B Test: We allocate in the beginning of the quiz. Control group goes through the BAU funnel, the Variation group sees the new question. Based on the submitted answer in the new question, the user might be exposed to the feature of different portion percentages on the plan cards. Main metric - Gross CVR from the 1st question in the funnel.

* Option 2: Full Funnel A/B/C Test: We allocate in the beginning of the quiz. Control group goes through the BAU funnel, the B Variation group sees the new question, but does not see the mixing. Variation C: Based on the submitted answer in the new question, the user might be exposed to the feature of different portion percentages on the plan cards.

Main metric - Gross CVR from the 1st question in the funnel.

* Option 3: Pre-post on the question and A/B Test on the plans page: All users are subject to the question (which will be tested as an pre-post analysis), but only Variation users will be able to be exposed to the portion % feature.

* Option 4: Pre-post on the question and A/B/C Test on the plans page: All users are subject to the question (which will be tested as an pre-post analysis), but only B and C Variation users will be able to be exposed to the portion % feature. On top, Variation C will be defaulted to a 50% plan when landing on the plans page

TBD 

Requirements

User Story

	Requirement

	Priority

	As a TPT prospect, I want to declare my mixed feeding habit in the quiz.

	A new question will be added to the quiz to identify users who mix TPT food with other products. Only these users will be exposed to the new portion percentage feature in the funnel.

	P0

	As an eligible user, I want to choose between 50%, 75%, and 100% plans for single-product types.

	The UI will allow users to select between 50%, 75%, and 100% plans. This selection must dynamically map to the closest available SKU based on the user's calculated caloric needs.

	P0

	As an eligible user, I want to see and easily compare the prices of diffe



hout portion %s with 3 plans (without topper)

   * If user selects that they want to mix, show plans page with portion %s and default the selection to the smaller portion %

   * If user selects that they are not sure, show plans page with portion %s and default the selection to the 100% portion

   * (33%traffic) Variation 2 - showing the question and defaulting to 100% plan for all users

   * Funnel: 

   * Show the question on Quiz 

   * If user selects that they do not want to mix, show plans page without portion %s with 3 plans (without topper)

   * If user selects that they want to mix or are not sure, show plans page with portion %s and default the selection to the 100% portion

Roll Out for all 3 variations:

   * Change plan

   * Show plans page with portion %s and pre-select the option based on their current plan and portion percentage

   * Re-take quiz & Multi Pet

   * No question on Quiz

   * Show plans page with portion %s and default the selection to the 100% portion













[a]@aw@hellofresh.com FYI for now

[b]@tatevik.shahnazaryan@ext.hellofresh.com @aw@hellofresh.com - updated this one based on the requirements from stakeholders

1 total reaction

[f]@maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com 





Is this true for control as well?

[g]I think something didn't save - can we default the user to the portion % they had selected before? (Corrected the copy

[h]and yes, we will maintain the same experience for all active users, these allocated to control, variation and not allocated at all

[i]Thanks for clarifying that. In that case, I'll just update the same under the "Control - BAU" section and let you know.

[j]Regarding the other question on loading the change plan screen with default. 





Yes, we can default to the current subscription plan as  selected based on the SKU and PetProfile portion percentage

[k]@gsun@hellofresh.com FYI - added. Let me know if there are any more gaps!

[l]This is correct!

### EMAIL: Berlin Offices holiday closures
ID: 19b12500ed76a7e4
From: HelloFresh Workplace <office@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi Everyone,



As the winter holidays approach, we're sharing key updates regarding our

office locations and services from December 19 through January 1.



Given that we all benefit from the generosity of the company granting

December 24th and 31st as additional paid holidays, and with the official

holidays (Dec 25, 26, Jan 1) falling on working days, we anticipate most

employees will be taking time off during this time period.



To facilitate essential year-end cleaning and align with the expected low

number of employees onsite, we are reducing the accessible office space as

follows.



   -



   Prinzenstr on the 4th and 5th floors

   -



   Reuchlinstr  Haus P



 All other areas/floors cannot be accessed during this time.



Service Reduction at Prinzenstr:



   -



   Day service janitorial services will be reduced during this period

   -



   All standard cereal options and beverage options will only be available

   in the 5th floor Kitchen.

   -



   Fruit baskets will not be delivered during this time

   -



   The Kids Corner will not be available



Prinzenstr. Operations:



   -



   Front desk reception will be staffed as normal

   -



   The gym will be operating as normal

   -



   Workplace Operations requests should be raised via Jira, as usual, for

   any building issues or concerns





If you have any questions or concerns please reach out to the Workplace

Operations Team

<https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/25>.



Wishing you a joyful holiday season and a Happy New Year!



Best regards,





*Your Workplace Operations Team *



*HelloFresh SE *| Prinzenstr. 89 | 10969 Berlin



Phone: +4930398200486 | Helpdesk:workplace.hellofresh.io

<https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/25>

Format: NGO-style bullets, structured sections

documents.title: DRAFT - Good Chop - Shopify Storefront
documents.content:
Ôªøüöß Overview





Good Chop - Shopify Storefront

	Created At: Oct 27, 2025

	Last Updated: Nov 12, 2025

	Status: In Progress

	Authors: Alison Ryan Sameer Doda

	



Summary[a]

This document outlines the approach and implementation strategy for to experiment with item-based pricing for Good Chop. This experiment will create a Shopify storefront to offer products through both one-time purchases and flexible subscriptions.

The primary objective is to create an new marketplace for Good Chop customers to order products in a flexible way vs the legacy site[b]. With the marketplace, we hope to gain insights into how product uptake, order habits, customer lifetime value, the existing experience. We will also evaluate the operational lift and cost-effectiveness of this new channel.

Strategy Review

Which initiatives are difficult or impossible to test with our current tech infrastructure?

Based on the provided documents, several key initiatives for the Good Chop brand are currently difficult or impossible to test due to foundational gaps in the technical infrastructure.

1. Dynamic and Item-Based Pricing

* The Barrier: The current platform relies on a "SKU-based product definition" (fixed prices for box plans). This architecture explicitly blocks the ability to run price experimentation or support item-based pricing (e.g., pricing specific cuts differently rather than using a flat plan rate).

* Impact: This prevents the testing of dynamic pricing per protein, a key initiative intended to allow customers to select plans and cuts based on varying quality levels (e.g., premium vs. standard cuts). It also hinders the transition to a hybrid e-commerce model that requires "planless" box sizes or premium bulk purchasing.

2. E-Commerce and One-Off Purchases

* The Barrier: There are "foundational gaps" between customer needs and the current HelloFresh core technology regarding e-commerce funnels, multiple subscriptions, and one-time purchases.

* Impact: It is currently difficult to test and enable one-off boxes (purchases without a subscription) or guest checkout capabilities, which are identified as critical for reducing barriers to entry. Capabilities for these features are being built (using Factor Form as a testing ground) to eventually allow for these experiments.

3. Frontend Experimentation and Shared Real Estate

* The Barrier: Running experiments directly on the homepage is not supported "out-of-the-box." For example, during a "LIFT Homepage redesign" test, the team could not allocate traffic on the page itself; allocation had to occur before customers reached the homepage, complicating the testing setup.

* Impact: It is difficult for multiple teams (e.g., Growth and Vertical-specific teams) to test or contribute to the same digital "real estate" (like funnel pages) without hitting significant technical dependencies. A "Contribution Model" is currently being developed to resolve this friction.

4. Data and Tracking

* The Barrier: There is "poor tracking quality" on Web properties and "even less" on RTE (Ready-to-Eat) mobile apps.

* Impact: The lack of a mature tracking infrastructure makes it difficult to accurately measure the impact of complex experiments across Good Chop's digital platforms.

5. Regional Pricing

* The Barrier: The current infrastructure does not support regional pricing variability.

* Impact: This limits Good Chop's ability to test price competitiveness in specific key markets like California, Texas, and Florida, which is a strategic priority for 2025.





What specific limitations exist today in terms of o



estricting access to existing services or the current marketplace. Crucially, the strategy dictates that Good Chop will not be limiting customers from their current account experience or the existing marketplace. This approach eliminates the immediate requirement for complex or specific customer redirection strategies.

Customers are fully empowered to maintain their current relationship with Good Chop:

         1. Subscription Management: Customers retain the ability to manage and modify their current account and subscription plans exactly as they do today. The existing customer portal and account management interface will remain fully operational and accessible.

         2. Exploring the New Storefront: Simultaneously, customers are encouraged to explore the new Shopify marketplace. This new storefront provides an optimized, modern e-commerce experience for discovering and ordering new products, one-time purchases, or managing new subscription sign-ups.

This parallel operational strategy ensures a seamless transition and maximum flexibility. By allowing customers to navigate between their established account portal and the new Shopify storefront, Good Chop mitigates disruption, respects customer familiarity with the current platform, and provides an immediate, value-added browsing and ordering experience through the new marketplace. Therefore, immediate, mandated redirection is unnecessary, as the two experiences are designed to coexist harmoniously, putting control and choice firmly in the hands of the customer.





The new Good Chop Shopify storefront is designed to enhance the customer experience without restricting access to existing services. Customers will not be limited from their current account experience or the existing marketplace, eliminating the need for immediate, complex redirection.

documents.title: PRD: Sign up page revamp
documents.content:
ÔªøSign up page revamp:

Scoping Document

	Summary: This document details the scope for the revamp of the sign up experience on ThePetsTable. We intend to improve the sign up experience to help customers move forward quickly and confidently to place their orders with The Pets Table.

	Created At: Dec 19, 2025

	Last Updated: Dec 22, 2025

	Editor(s): prateek jajoo

	Strategy: New Ventures TPT: Drive a cumulative $6M incremental cumulative CVA as measured by A/B experiments or rollouts in TPT

	Figma link

	



Why improve the sign up page?:

Data reveals (chart below) that the registration page on ThePetsTable adds little friction to the customer journey to the address page. In 2025, the total ‚ÄúVisited Address‚Äù (12.25%) sessions is higher than ‚ÄúVisited Registration‚Äù (11.62%) sessions for PetsTable, this is in sharp contrast to the HelloFresh sessions data, where over 55% users are lost from registration to address page. The sessions drop off in PetsTable is significantly lower because of two reasons:





1. The registration page is skipped entirely for customers who logged in a previous session, and are redirected to the checkout page directly by the site cookies. HelloFresh also has the same behavior but in the case of PetsTable, the customer is completing registration often and also coming back more often to a previously logged in session. 





2. The higher registration completion rate can also be attributed to high intent and cognitive investment of the customer, who before reaching the registration page has completed 9 steps of the quiz (which sometimes needs research - pup weight, dietary preference, allergies, goals) and selected the plan & recipe selection. Plus, increasing propensity to make more premium & health conscious choices for their pets over themselves, drives higher intent in completion of the PetsTable account registration, than that of HelloFresh. 





Given that the registration step isn‚Äôt resulting in customer drop offs, the removal of the page is not likely to increase conversions. The registration page is in fact necessary to verify whether a prospect already has an account, which helps in redirecting existing users to the reactivation page (and adjusting applicable discounts), and prevents them from redundantly navigating the entire signup funnel. After enabling email autopopulation on the registration page from WKND cookie, the friction on this page has declined further. Therefore, we advocate to keep the registration page, make minimal functional changes and improve the sign up CTA to increase the customer intent further to complete checkout.

The Pets Table (More sessions to Address page than the Registration page):

  







Hello Fresh (Over 55% customers drop from Registration page to Address page):

  







  Current Experience:

Note that the funnel data above captures conversions from the registration page before we started auto populating the customer email from the WKND cookie (link). In majority of the cases, customers will now see the email populated and are directly prompted to enter a password, which should be a delightful customer experience. 





Given that we do not have any password rules or checks currently on the page, customers can set any password and can navigate to the address page. HelloFresh data also shows that only 3.4% users abandon (link) the registration process without submitting a password after providing their email address. 





However, we can optimize this page UI to move away from a transactional tone to an emotional tone to further improve customer intent to comp



 what benefits other users have realized by using PetsTable for their pups.

	Improve UX to social proof and product stats from real customers to increase confidence in product quality ‚ÄúLoved by 200k+ Golden retrievers‚Äù / ‚ÄúMade in USA‚Äù, / ‚ÄúImproved immune system‚Äù 

	P1 





Impact: medium

Effort: 1-2pts

	Passwordless Sign up

	Customers currently need to add a password on the registration page

	In HelloFresh, adding passwordless (statsig) sign ups improved conversion rate by 0.8%. 





However, HelloFresh data also shows that only 3.4% users abandon (link) the registration process without submitting a password after providing their email address. Therefore, the password itself is not a friction point but providing another way to login could help conversions. 





Though an innovative way to login may not result in a similar increase in conversions from older customer base, who are more accustomed to login/password UX, and are already comfortable completing registrations on the PetsTable.   

	P1 





Impact: Medium

Effort: 8 pts





	Use social logins

	Provide customers with social login options like  Apple, Google & Facebook to improve registration completion and improve conversions

	In HelloFresh, adding social logins (statsig) increased the conversion rate by 2.66%. However, we hypothesize social logins will not have much impact on registration completion rate in the PetsTable (& thus conversions) as our customer demographics is much older (>50% customers are 50+ years old), who are less likely to use social logins.

	P2





Impact: Low

Effort: 8 pts

	















Open Question: Do we remove the Add-ons promotions CTA?

Rationale for keeping the Add-ons banner:

1. Two experiments that tested adding a seasonal promotional banner on the Sign up page resulted (in a similar location as the Add-ons promotional banner) in positive improvements in CVR. 

2. Customers hear about the Add-ons product for the first time in the sign up page and create intent to buy add-ons during checkout. 

Rationale for removing Add-ons banner:

1. Test moving one of the below the fold element (Social proof, product stat) on the banner location to further increase customer intent on checkout. 





Given that we already prioritized an initiative (improve sign up CTA) to improve content and don't have experimental bandwidth, we recommend to keep the add-ons banner.

However, we hypothesize social logins will not have much impact on registration completion rate in the PetsTable (& thus conversions) as our customer demographics is much older (>50% customers are 50+ years old), who are less likely to use social logins.

Impact: Low

Effort: 8 pts

Rationale for keeping the Add-ons banner:

1. Two experiments that tested adding a seasonal promotional banner on the Sign up page resulted (in a similar location as the Add-ons promotional banner) in positive improvements in CVR. 

2. Customers hear about the Add-ons product for the first time in the sign up page and create intent to buy add-ons during checkout. 

Rationale for removing Add-ons banner:

1. Test moving one of the below the fold element (Social proof, product stat) on the banner location to further increase customer intent on checkout. 





Given that we already prioritized an initiative (improve sign up CTA) to improve content and don't have experimental bandwidth, we recommend to keep the add-ons banner.
